name: 'The Birdcage' vs. 'La Cage Aux Folles' Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: What year was 'La Cage Aux Folles' released?
questions.explanation:
1978.

	I remember my Mom taking me to a foreign film festival in 1978 to see this movie. Although I was very young, I thought the film was hilarious.

1996.

	I thought that the cast of 'The Birdcage' did a wonderful job the this remake.

questions.text: In both movies, Renato Baldi and Armand Goldman owned what?
questions.explanation:
A nightclub involving female impersonators.

	Comedian Robin Williams played 'Armand Goldman' and legendary Italian actor Ugo Tognazzi played 'Renato Baldi'.

questions.text: What is 'La Cage Aux Folles' translated into English?
questions.explanation:
A cage of fools.

	The orininal title for 'The Birdcage' was to be 'Birds of a Feather'.

questions.text: In 'La Cage Aux Folles', what city does the couple live in?
questions.explanation:
St. Tropez

	'The Birdcage' takes place in South Beach.

questions.text: The flamboyant housekeepers in both movies hate to do what?
questions.explanation:
Wear shoes.

	Somehow, wearing a tuxedo without shoes doesn't look quite right.

questions.text: In 'La Cage Aux Folles', which language was spoken?
questions.explanation:
French.

	If one doesn't speak French, I would imagine a lot of the humor gets lost in the translation.

questions.text: Which movie received an Academy Award nomination?
questions.explanation:
Both.

	'La Cage Aux Folles' received a nomination for its director, Edouard Molinaro and 'The Birdcage' received an nomination for Best Art Direction-Set Decoration.

questions.text: In both movies, drag queens Albert Goldman and Albin Mougeotte had the stagename, 'Starina'.
questions.explanation:
False.

	'Albert' (Nathan Lane)had the stagename, 'Starina', however 'Albin's' (Michel Serrault) stagename was 'Zaza Napoli'.

questions.text: 'The Birdcage' does not have any sequels. As well, 'La Cage Aux Folles' does not have any sequels.
questions.explanation:
False.

	'La Cage Aux Folles' has two sequels, 'La Cage Aux Folles II' (1980), and 'La Cage Aux Folles - The Wedding' (1985). I would like it if 'The Birdcage' came out with a sequel.
